title: Manchester United target Thomas Muller admits to being unsettled at Bayern Munich under Carlo Ancelotti
text:
Sport Manchester United target Thomas Muller admits to being unsettled at Bayern Munich under Carlo Ancelotti The Germany striker has struggled this season and started on the bench in the big clash against Leipzig Share Thomas Muller has endured a tough season after Carlo Ancelotti took over from Pep Guardiola (Photo: Joosep Martinson) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester United target Thomas Muller has admitted he is dissatisfied with life at Bayern Munich right now. 
The Germany star has failed to adjust to suit Carlo Ancelotti's tactics and even found himself benched for the crunch clash against RB Leipzig. 
The 27-year-old, who has been linked with the Red Devils for some time, failed to hide his unhappiness when quizzed on his situation. 
"The last game against Leipzig was not optimal for me personally, since I did not play," Muller told Bild. The Italian coach does not use a support striker in his system (Photo: REUTERS) Muller looks dejected after a shock defeat to Rostov (Photo: Joosep Martinson) 
"There was more space than in the games before. It was a game I could have enjoyed. 
"Of course, I’m not sitting there with a grin on the bench." Muller celebrates his only Bundesliga goal of the season vs Wolfsburg 
Bayern Munich legend Lothar Matthaus also cast doubt on Muller's future recently. 
"There is not really a position in Ancelotti’s formation that suits him," Matthaus wrote in his column for Bild. poll loading Should Thomas Muller submit a transfer request at Bayern Munich? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
